message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG 

This paper deals with identifying root sources in textual conversation threads, which is a problem related to natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses a generative model based on marked multivariate Hawkes processes, which is a statistical modeling technique used in many areas of computer science, including social network analysis and machine learning. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with analyzing real-world data, which involves data management and analysis techniques, making cs.SD (Databases) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with identifying patterns and structures in textual data, which is related to information retrieval, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible sub-category as well.
